title: Box Model - Visual Builder (Beginner)
description: Learn the CSS box model using interactive visual controls

steps.title: Step 1: Understanding the Box Model
steps.content:
Every HTML element is a box! The CSS box model has four parts:
- **Content** - The actual content (text, images)
- **Padding** - Space inside the element, around content
- **Border** - A line around the padding
- **Margin** - Space outside the element

Use the controls to adjust each part and see the changes in real-time!

task.instruction: Use the +/- buttons to set padding to 20px and margin to 10px:

steps.title: Step 2: Positioning Elements
steps.content:
The `position` property controls how elements are placed on the page. Use `top`, `left`, `right`, and `bottom` to move positioned elements.

Try moving the box around the screen!

task.instruction: Move the box to top: 50px and left: 100px:

steps.title: Step 3: Size Controls
steps.content:
Control element dimensions with `width` and `height` properties.

Make the box bigger and smaller to see how it affects the layout!

task.instruction: Set width to 150px and height to 100px:
task.previewElement: Resize Me

steps.title: Step 4: Border Styling
steps.content:
Borders have three properties: width, style, and color.

Experiment with different border widths and see how it affects the box!
steps.visual: Bordered Box

task.instruction: Set border-width to 4px and border-radius to 10px:
task.previewElement: Styled Box

steps.title: Step 5: Complete!
steps.content:
Awesome! You've learned the box model using visual controls. Now you understand:
- Padding (inside spacing)
- Margin (outside spacing)
- Borders (element outline)
- Positioning (moving elements)
- Sizing (width & height)

Ready for intermediate mode where you'll edit code directly?
